segments.text: I notice the boy reaching into the cookie jar, balancing on that wobbly stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He looks so determined, but that stool is about to tip over.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t watch—what if he falls?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl beside him is just waiting for a cookie, completely oblivious to the danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she trusts him to hand her one without falling.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman drying dishes has no idea what’s happening behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s sad that she’s so distracted by something so small.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’ll ever notice the mess or the kids.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just getting worse, and she’s still polishing that plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how much of a mess this kitchen is becoming.
segments.speaker: PAR
